==Events==
*[[411 BC]] &ndash; The [[Athenian coup of 411 BC|Athenian coup]] succeeds, forming a short-lived [[oligarchy]].
*  [[53]] &ndash; The [[Roman Emperor]] [[Nero]] marries [[Claudia Octavia]].
*  [[68]] &ndash; The [[Roman Emperor]] [[Nero]] commits suicide, after quoting [[Homer]]'s ''[[Iliad]]'', thus ending the [[Julio-Claudian dynasty]] and starting the civil war known as the [[Year of the Four Emperors]].
* [[721]] &ndash; [[Odo of Aquitaine]] defeats the [[Moors]] in the [[Battle of Toulouse (721)|Battle of Toulouse]].
*[[1311]] &ndash; [[Duccio]]'s [[Maestà (Duccio)|Maestà]] [[Altarpiece]], a seminal artwork of the early [[Italian Renaissance]], is unveiled and installed in [[Siena Cathedral]] in [[Siena]], Italy.
*[[1534]] &ndash; [[Jacques Cartier]] is the first European to discover the [[Saint Lawrence River]].
*[[1650]] &ndash; The [[President and Fellows of Harvard College|Harvard Corporation]], the more powerful of the two administrative boards of [[Harvard]], is established. It is the first legal [[corporation]] in the Americas.
*[[1667]] &ndash; The [[Raid on the Medway]] by the [[Netherlands|Dutch]] fleet in the [[Second Anglo-Dutch War]] begins. It lasts for five days and results in the worst ever defeat of the [[Royal Navy]]. 
*[[1732]] &ndash; [[James Oglethorpe]] is granted a [[royal charter]] for the colony of the future U.S. state of [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]].
*[[1762]] &ndash; [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] forces begin the [[Battle of Havana (1762)|Siege of Havana]] and capture the city during the [[Seven Years' War]].
*[[1772]] &ndash; The [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] [[schooner]] ''[[Gaspée Affair|Gaspée]]'' is burned off the coast of [[Rhode Island]].
*[[1798]] &ndash; [[Irish Rebellion of 1798]]: [[Battle of Arklow]] and [[Battle of Saintfield]].
*[[1815]] &ndash; End of the [[Congress of Vienna]]: the new European political situation is set.
*[[1856]] &ndash; 500 [[Mormon handcart pioneers|Mormon]]s leave [[Iowa City, Iowa]], and head west for [[Salt Lake City]] carrying all their possessions in two-wheeled [[cart|handcart]]s.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Stonewall Jackson]] concludes his successful [[Jackson's Valley Campaign|Shenandoah Valley Campaign]] with a victory in the [[Battle of Port Republic]]; his tactics during the campaign are now studied by militaries around the world.
*[[1863]] &ndash; American Civil War: [[Battle of Brandy Station]], [[Virginia]].
*[[1873]] &ndash; [[Alexandra Palace]] in London burns down after being open for only 16 days.
*[[1885]] &ndash; [[Treaty of Tientsin (1885)|Treaty of Tientsin]] is signed to end the [[Sino-French War]], with [[Qing dynasty|China]] eventually giving up [[Tonkin]] and [[Annam (Chinese province)|Annam]] – most of present-day [[Vietnam]] – to France.
*[[1900]] &ndash; [[Birsa Munda]], an important figure in the [[Indian independence movement]], dies in a British prison under mysterious circumstances.
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[William Jennings Bryan]] resigns as [[Woodrow Wilson]]'s [[United States Secretary of State|Secretary of State]] over a disagreement regarding the United States' handling of the sinking of the {{RMS|Lusitania}}.
*[[1923]] &ndash; [[Bulgaria]]'s military takes over the government in a [[Bulgarian coup d'état of 1923|coup]].
*[[1928]] &ndash; [[Charles Kingsford Smith]] completes the first trans-Pacific flight in a [[Fokker F.VII|Fokker Trimotor monoplane]], the ''[[Southern Cross (aircraft)|Southern Cross]]''.
*[[1930]] &ndash; A ''[[Chicago Tribune]]'' reporter, [[Jake Lingle]], is killed during rush hour at the [[Illinois]] Central train station by [[Leo Vincent Brothers]], allegedly over a $100,000 gambling debt owed to [[Al Capone]].
*[[1934]] &ndash; [[Donald Duck]] makes his debut in ''[[The Wise Little Hen]]''.
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: 99 civilians are hanged from lampposts and balconies by German troops in [[Tulle]], France, in reprisal for [[Maquis du Limousin|maquisards]] attacks.
*  1944   &ndash; [[World War II]]: the [[Soviet Union]] invades [[East Karelia]] and the [[Karelia (historical province of Finland)|previously Finnish part of Karelia]], occupied by Finland since [[1941]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; King [[Ananda Mahidol]] is found shot dead in his bedroom, [[Bhumibol Adulyadej]] ascends to the throne of [[Thailand]]. He is currently the world's longest reigning monarch.
*[[1948]] &ndash; Foundation of the [[International Council on Archives]] under the auspices of the UNESCO.
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Flint–Worcester tornado outbreak sequence]]: a tornado spawned from the same storm system as the Flint tornado hits in [[Worcester, Massachusetts]], killing 94.
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[McCarthyism]]: [[Joseph Welch]], special counsel for the [[United States Army]], lashes out at [[United States Senate|Senator]] [[Joseph McCarthy]] during hearings on whether [[Communism]] has infiltrated the [[United States Army|Army]] giving McCarthy the famous rebuke, "You've done enough. Have you no sense of decency, sir, at long last? Have you left no sense of decency?"
*[[1957]] &ndash; First ascent of [[Broad Peak]] by [[Fritz Wintersteller]], [[Marcus Schmuck]], [[Kurt Diemberger]], and [[Hermann Buhl]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; Queen [[Elizabeth II]] officially opens London's [[Gatwick Airport]] in [[Crawley]], [[West Sussex]], United Kingdom.
*[[1959]] &ndash; The {{USS|George Washington|SSBN-598|6}} is launched. It is the first [[submarine]] to carry [[ballistic missile]]s.
*[[1965]] &ndash; The civilian Prime Minister of [[South Vietnam]], [[Phan Huy Quát]], resigns after being unable to work with a junta led by [[Nguyễn Cao Kỳ]].
*  1965   &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The [[Viet Cong]] commences combat with the [[Army of the Republic of Vietnam]] in the [[Battle of Dong Xoai]], one of the largest battles in the war.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Six-Day War]]: [[Israel]] captures the [[Golan Heights]] from [[Syria]]
*[[1968]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] declares a national day of mourning following the [[assassination of Senator Robert F. Kennedy]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; Severe rainfall causes a dam in the [[Black Hills]] of [[South Dakota]] to burst, creating [[1972 Black Hills flood|a flood]] that kills 238 people and causes $160 million in damage.
*[[1973]] &ndash; In horseracing, [[Secretariat (horse)|Secretariat]] wins the [[Triple Crown of Thoroughbred Racing|Triple Crown]].
*[[1974]] &ndash; Portugal and the [[Soviet Union]] establish [[diplomatic relations]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints]] opens its [[Priesthood (Mormonism)|priesthood]] to "all worthy men", ending a 148-year-old policy of excluding black men.
*[[1979]] &ndash; The [[1979 Sydney Ghost Train fire|Ghost Train fire]] at [[Luna Park Sydney]] (Australia) kills seven.
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[Thomas Sutherland (academic)|Thomas Sutherland]] is kidnapped in [[Lebanon]]. He will not be released until [[1991]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Kosovo War]]: the [[Federal Republic of Yugoslavia]] and [[NATO]] sign a [[peace treaty]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[60th Anniversary Celebrations of Bhumibol Adulyadej's Accession|60th Anniversary Celebrations]] of [[Bhumibol Adulyadej]]'s Accession.
